body: This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with some advantages: - Groupchats are now saved into tox_save. - Clients can get groupchat unique id to save message log. - Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses non-upgraded version. Submission will happen through #295. Review this PR only. --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/826)

---

*[toxcore/group.c, line 2586 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/826#-L6gAhNeMvVq3ywyOgJS:-L6gAhNeMvVq3ywyOgJT:bo0bl7x) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/6fa4089213f64baf9249ccfb8bfdd482f05de6bc/toxcore/group.c#L2586)):*

> ```

I think this magic `+ 100` thing is only used to get into the condition below, would be better to replace it with a flag variable

This were the last things I saw, from my side --- Review status: 11 of 14 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/826#-:-L7AW3lvNze81yyNvZtB:bi4egl1)*
Review a month, how is it goingï¼Ÿ

I've been testing persistent groups with toxcore 0.2.2 for a week now. The biggest surprise for me was that they work even if I'm the only peer in a group who uses them. Other peers in a group don't need to have toxcore with persistent group chats to allow me to reconnect automatically. The biggest problem that I've noticed is that there is no indication that someone left the group while I was offline. Which means I will often wait to get reconnected, but it might never happen, because the other peers might have left. This could be partially fixed by clients. Instead of creating a persistent group only when we are invited to it, they should be always created on client start. That way it would be visible that we are in a group, even when none of the peers are online or they have left the group.

> The biggest problem that I've noticed is that there is no indication that someone left the group while I was offline.

 for persistent conference, seems need some way to get persistent peer list, and every peers online status.

Yes, that would be great to have at some point.

I also have some weird issues with toxync and persistent groups. I don't get reconnected to toxync groups with autoinvite disabled when I come online, but when I then ask toxync to send me an invite to that group, it gets accepted without my permission. It's very strange, because it only happens with toxync groups.
https://github.com/sudden6/c-toxcore/commit/2af7cb6fad978ab5507e5c0db4fb7d6f88ac1bb1 fixes a crash that happens when `peer->nick` is NULL and cleans up the initialisation of that structure.
@tox-user that auto-accept without permission: how does that happen? toxcore can't do that, so it has to be qtox.

Bugs filed against isotoxin's toxcore-vs (where the PGC code originated from):
* https://github.com/isotoxin/toxcore-vs/issues/3
* https://github.com/isotoxin/toxcore-vs/issues/4

These issues block the merge, since we have tests for both the issues. Travis CI won't let us submit before these are fixed.

@iphydf when you don't get reconnected to a group automatically like you should (another bug) and a peer from that group invites you, their invite will be auto accepted. I imagine Tox assumes it's the same invite as the one it should have received for auto join and accepts it. Here are the exact steps to reproduce it: https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/960

commit.message:
Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.

This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with
some advantages:
- Groupchats are now saved into tox_save.
- Clients can get groupchat unique id to save message log.
- Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses
  non-upgraded version.

committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1534113047 +0000

Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.

This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with
some advantages:
- Groupchats are now saved into tox_save.
- Clients can get groupchat unique id to save message log.
- Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses
  non-upgraded version.

commit.message:
create propper constructor for Group_Peer and fix crash

The crash happened, because the 'free_peer_members' function didn't set
'nick_len = 0'

tree 02034e0c328c94571e86beb9cc49565faf19b46b

author sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1528838947 +0200
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1534113047 +0000

create propper constructor for Group_Peer and fix crash

The crash happened, because the 'free_peer_members' function didn't set
'nick_len = 0'

title: WIP: Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.
